match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Pakistan won by 6 wickets (with 28 balls remaining) (D/L method)

image.caption: A view of the SuperSport Park from the stands
image.longCaption: A view of the SuperSport Park from the stands, South Africa v New Zealand, 2nd Test, Centurion, 2nd day, November 17, 2007

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.long: c Shoaib Malik b Mohammad Hafeez
dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Shoaib Malik b Mohammad Hafeez 58 (82b 5x4 0x6 123m) SR: 70.73

dismissalComment.html: Behardien's gone, shortish from Hafeez and he tried to clear deep square leg, was slightly short and he pulled it high but couldn't get the distance

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Jamshed b Saeed Ajmal
dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson c Nasir Jamshed b Saeed Ajmal 44 (67b 3x4 0x6 88m) SR: 65.67

dismissalComment.html: Peterson falls, South Africa have been bowled out, tries to drag it from well outside off over midwicket, Ajmal had slowed it up, gets a top-edge and it's an easy catch to short third man

that's out, big sound, good length this time and Amla chased that one, not much footwork there, just went hard at that one, aiming to crack it through cover, appeared to get a thin inside edge there and Akmal took it easily, Irfan has struck

headshotImage.caption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: appeal for a catch and it's been turned down, Misbah wants a review, Kamran Akmal was convinced but Irfan went up belatedly, landed on a good length, he opted to play that off the back foot, there was a sound as it went past the bat, but Hot Spot doesn't show any heat signature there. It wasn't the bat hitting pad either, because there was no contact between those two. There was a sound, but was there any compelling evidence that there was a touch? Dharmasena is the third umpire and he reckons the sound is good enough to change the decision, even though Hot Spot didn't reveal anything. Hmm, it's been given out.

edged and gone! No doubts about this one, de Villiers was again in two minds about this, short outside off and he belatedly decided to go for it, tried to guide him past the slips there but got a thick edge and second slip snapped that with no trouble, three down now and South Africa in a bit of trouble

Faf goes, Irfan reacts well, extra bounce doing the trick again! Took off from short of a good length and surprised Faf, who came on the front foot and tried hard to keep it down, taking his bottom-hand off, but it got him on his glove and lobbed back towards the bowler, Irfan bent low and to his left and took it one-handed, five down now

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ajmal strikes, a leading edge, don't think he picked the straighter one there, or it may have been a doosra, closed the face on that one and offered a simple catch to mid-off running to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Ryan McLaren lbw b Mohammad Hafeez 17 (31b 0x4 0x6 45m) SR: 54.83

dismissalComment.html: Given out this time, fires it quicker this time, appeared adjacent again, reaches forward to defend but that appeared to go straight on, seemed to strike him in line with middle and leg as he missed an attempt to block that, Pakistan have struck

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's bowled! Kamran Akmal was tempted by that tossed up delivery, tried to swing it hard over midwicket, missed, was struck on the toe and the ball rolled back onto the stumps, Pakistan in a bit of trouble now, got an inside edge onto the toe, mid-on and mid-off were inside the circle

gone! Dismissed off a full toss, struck it too well, picked it from middle and swept it straight to Amla at deep square leg, this makes things more interesting, he was batting positively and he picked the right ball there but found the fielder

Steyn has got rid of Hafeez again, that's the fifth time he's got him out this tour, on a length and Hafeez just chipped that through the line, midwicket was alert and dived to his left to catch that with a dive, Steyn gives Hafeez a send-off, Pakistan have lost their openers

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Jamshed c Smith b McLaren 10 (19b 1x4 0x6 34m) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: Jamshed falls! Excellent catch at slip, a dismissal not too different from AB de Villiers' this afternoon, short of a length and he tries to guide it past the slip fielder towards third man, got a thick edge and found slip, who dived well to his left to pouch that one, Smith was the man

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez c Abbott b Steyn 31 (49b 3x4 1x6 60m) SR: 63.26

dismissalComment.html: Steyn has got rid of Hafeez again, that's the fifth time he's got him out this tour, on a length and Hafeez just chipped that through the line, midwicket was alert and dived to his left to catch that with a dive, Steyn gives Hafeez a send-off, Pakistan have lost their openers

Kamran Akmal was tempted by that tossed up delivery, tried to swing it hard over midwicket, missed, was struck on the toe and the ball rolled back onto the stumps, Pakistan in a bit of trouble now, got an inside edge onto the toe, mid-on and mid-off were inside the circle

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short and wide and he goes for the cut, misses, but Billy Bowden reckons its a wide and he calls it, Pakistan have won

commentPostTextItems.html: A comfortable win in the end for Pakistan, though they had some nervy moments in the chase. South Africa's top-order collapse proved costly for the hosts, and Pakistan kept them down to a chaseable score despite a recovery staged by Behardien and Peterson. Three down in their chase, Pakistan would have been nervous, but Misbah, Younis and Malik, all experienced players, saw them team through, never allowing the required-rate get out of control. Pakistan have levelled the series 1-1, we'll get you the presentation details in a bit.

AB de Villiers: "Disappointing performance, Pakistan took the initiative early on. We fought back nicely, got a decent target towards the end. Look back now, I'll definitely be bowling first. Misbah and company played too well in the middle overs. I'm proud of the boys for fighting back. It's still a big series. We are mature enough to know exactly where we went wrong. Come Sunday, we'll come back fighting again. Hopefully, there'll be pace and bounce in Johannesburg."

Misbah-ul-Haq: "The way we started, Irfan taking four wickets in 10 overs, that set the game as well. All the other bowlers bowled well, and we performed well with the bat. It is really satisfying for us, the batsmen are getting the confidence back. Picking Irfan was an attacking move, he gave us a big advantage. There were a few spots in the pitch where the ball was stopping and kicking, there was a bit of variable bounce, it was not easy to bat on. We really get good support here from the crowd. We need to keep this momentum. We're settling down and getting out, we need to show responsibility, if someone gets 20-30 runs, he needs to carry on."

Mohammad Irfan is the Man of the Match: The bowling coach Mohammad Akram will translate for him. Mohammad Akram: "It's his first Man of the Match performance, hopefully there will be many more to come." Irfan: "Thanks to Allah, my team management and coaches have supported me and hopefully I'll do well the next time. The captain had given us a plan, and I just worked on it. Hopefully I'll perform well in the next game and give my 100 per cent."
That's it, folks, thanks for tuning in and sending us your feedback. See you guys again on Sunday. Adios.

commentTextItems.html: short of a good length, gets on the back foot and he pushes it back to the bowler
short of a good length, knocks that one down in front of point, Malik wants the single, Misbah says no
full toss on middle, turns it away towards deep square leg to level the scores

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: That's been dismissed, pitched on a length, Misbah made room and absolutely hammered that over extra cover for a flat six
drops that one short and Misbah seeks that through to the keeper
turned away behind square for a single
slower one bowled short, Misbah rolls his wrists over that one and plays it down towards deep square leg for a single to bring up his half-century

commentPostTextItems.html: A calm innings that's guided his team towards victory after the loss of three wickets. He's taken some flak for being too slow to start, but he's picked up pace at the right time today

commentTextItems.html: outstanding shot, angling in towards middle and he lofted him straight over his head for a boundary, nicely done, just through the line
Malik tries to squeeze that down to third man as well but point gets in the way

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short of a good length, a bit of width there and he guides that one down to third man for a single
chops that one down towards point on the bounce
drops that one from the crease in front of point and races off for a quick single
shortish outside off, cut away to third man for a single
ooh, that caught him on the glove, took off as he tried to play it on the off side, was fortunate it landed safe in front of point
getting a bit of away movement is Steyn, Malik rocks forward and defends that to cover

headshotImage.caption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoaib Malik player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: goodish length and that's been defended well towards point

commentPreTextItems.html: Mazher: "Shoaib Malik has hit first ODI six in four years today. Last one was in 2009 against Australia, also at Centurion!"

commentTextItems.html: short and wide and Malik cuts that over gully towards third man for a couple of runs
a bit of room there, guided it to point, Malik decided against the single and an overthrow got them one
short of a length outside off, leaves that one alone to the keeper

dismissalComment.html: appeal for a catch and it's been turned down, Misbah wants a review, Kamran Akmal was convinced but Irfan went up belatedly, landed on a good length, he opted to play that off the back foot, there was a sound as it went past the bat, but Hot Spot doesn't show any heat signature there. It wasn't the bat hitting pad either, because there was no contact between those two. There was a sound, but was there any compelling evidence that there was a touch? Dharmasena is the third umpire and he reckons the sound is good enough to change the decision, even though Hot Spot didn't reveal anything. Hmm, it's been given out.

edged and gone! No doubts about this one, de Villiers was again in two minds about this, short outside off and he belatedly decided to go for it, tried to guide him past the slips there but got a thick edge and second slip snapped that with no trouble, three down now and South Africa in a bit of trouble

Faf goes, Irfan reacts well, extra bounce doing the trick again! Took off from short of a good length and surprised Faf, who came on the front foot and tried hard to keep it down, taking his bottom-hand off, but it got him on his glove and lobbed back towards the bowler, Irfan bent low and to his left and took it one-handed, five down now

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Smith goes as well, he's not going to review it, he's walking back, short ball outside off and Smith tried to pull it square, got a faint nick and Kamran took it comfortably, a slight under-edge and he's gone as well
bowled'im! On a length and Steyn tries to push that through the line, he remains on nought after all that, misses and is bowled

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ajmal strikes, a leading edge, don't think he picked the straighter one there, or it may have been a doosra, closed the face on that one and offered a simple catch to mid-off running to his left

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Peterson falls, South Africa have been bowled out, tries to drag it from well outside off over midwicket, Ajmal had slowed it up, gets a top-edge and it's an easy catch to short third man

headshotImage.longCaption: Umar Gul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Given out this time, fires it quicker this time, appeared adjacent again, reaches forward to defend but that appeared to go straight on, seemed to strike him in line with middle and leg as he missed an attempt to block that, Pakistan have struck
Behardien's gone, shortish from Hafeez and he tried to clear deep square leg, was slightly short and he pulled it high but couldn't get the distance

dismissalText.long: c Kamran Akmal b Mohammad Irfan
dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Kamran Akmal b Mohammad Irfan 17 (16b 3x4 0x6 19m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: that's out, big sound, good length this time and Amla chased that one, not much footwork there, just went hard at that one, aiming to crack it through cover, appeared to get a thin inside edge there and Akmal took it easily, Irfan has struck

dismissalComment.html: appeal for a catch and it's been turned down, Misbah wants a review, Kamran Akmal was convinced but Irfan went up belatedly, landed on a good length, he opted to play that off the back foot, there was a sound as it went past the bat, but Hot Spot doesn't show any heat signature there. It wasn't the bat hitting pad either, because there was no contact between those two. There was a sound, but was there any compelling evidence that there was a touch? Dharmasena is the third umpire and he reckons the sound is good enough to change the decision, even though Hot Spot didn't reveal anything. Hmm, it's been given out.

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson c Nasir Jamshed b Saeed Ajmal 44 (67b 3x4 0x6 88m) SR: 65.67

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Jamshed c Smith b McLaren 10 (19b 1x4 0x6 34m) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: Jamshed falls! Excellent catch at slip, a dismissal not too different from AB de Villiers' this afternoon, short of a length and he tries to guide it past the slip fielder towards third man, got a thick edge and found slip, who dived well to his left to pouch that one, Smith was the man

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez c Abbott b Steyn 31 (49b 3x4 1x6 60m) SR: 63.26

dismissalComment.html: Steyn has got rid of Hafeez again, that's the fifth time he's got him out this tour, on a length and Hafeez just chipped that through the line, midwicket was alert and dived to his left to catch that with a dive, Steyn gives Hafeez a send-off, Pakistan have lost their openers

headshotImage.caption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Kamran Akmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kamran Akmal b Peterson 18 (14b 2x4 0x6 34m) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: that's bowled! Kamran Akmal was tempted by that tossed up delivery, tried to swing it hard over midwicket, missed, was struck on the toe and the ball rolled back onto the stumps, Pakistan in a bit of trouble now, got an inside edge onto the toe, mid-on and mid-off were inside the circle

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Younis Khan c Amla b Peterson 32 (41b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 78.04

dismissalComment.html: gone! Dismissed off a full toss, struck it too well, picked it from middle and swept it straight to Amla at deep square leg, this makes things more interesting, he was batting positively and he picked the right ball there but found the fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Misbah-ul-Haq not out 57 (75b 3x4 3x6 112m) SR: 76

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 52 runs, 4 wickets)
Over 4.3: Review by Pakistan (Bowling), Umpire - AT Holdstock, Batsman - CA Ingram (Upheld)
South Africa: 50 runs in 9.1 overs (55 balls), Extras 4
Drinks: South Africa - 76/5 in 14.0 overs (F Behardien 15, R McLaren 8)
South Africa: 100 runs in 18.1 overs (109 balls), Extras 6
Over 20.2: Review by Pakistan (Bowling), Umpire - AT Holdstock, Batsman - R McLaren (Struck down)
F Behardien: 50 off 60 balls (5 x 4)
South Africa: 150 runs in 32.4 overs (196 balls), Extras 7
Drinks: South Africa - 151/6 in 33.0 overs (F Behardien 55, RJ Peterson 24)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 81 balls (F Behardien 21, RJ Peterson 25, Ex 4)
Rain: South Africa - 177/7 in 38.4 overs (RJ Peterson 39, KJ Abbott 4)
Over 40.4: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - AT Holdstock, Batsman - DW Steyn (Upheld)
Innings Break: South Africa - 191/10 in 43.2 overs (LL Tsotsobe 0)
Pakistan innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 41 runs, 1 wicket)
Pakistan: 50 runs in 12.1 overs (73 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: Pakistan - 63/2 in 13.2 overs (Kamran Akmal 17)
Over 18.5: Review by Pakistan (Batting), Umpire - AT Holdstock, Batsman - Younis Khan (Upheld)
Pakistan: 100 runs in 23.6 overs (144 balls), Extras 5
Drinks: Pakistan - 115/4 in 25.4 overs (Misbah-ul-Haq 18)
Pakistan: 150 runs in 32.2 overs (194 balls), Extras 8
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 48 balls (Misbah-ul-Haq 19, Shoaib Malik 29, Ex 2)
Powerplay 2: Overs 36.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 20 runs, 0 wicket)
Misbah-ul-Haq: 50 off 70 balls (3 x 4, 2 x 6)

stories.title: South Africa v Pakistan, 2012-13
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review:  South Africa v Pakistan, 2012-13
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, South Africa v Pakistan, 2012-13

stories.title: First ten overs decided the match - Misbah
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: First ten overs decided the match - Misbah-ul-Haq
stories.summary: Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said his team had effectively won the second ODI in Centurion in the first ten overs of the South Africa innings, when the hosts had lost four wickets

image.caption: Mohammad Irfan plucks a catch one-handed off his own bowling
image.longCaption: Mohammad Irfan plucks a catch one-handed off his own bowling, South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion, March 15, 2013

stories.title: Irfan, Misbah star as Pakistan draw level
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Mohammad Irfan, Misbah-ul-Haq star as Pakistan draw level
stories.summary: Pakistan's decision to include an extra pace bowler yielded rich rewards as Mohammed Irfan extracted significant bounce from the Centurion surface to dismantle South Africa's top order
stories.byline: The Report by Firdose Moonda in Centurion

image.caption: Mohammad Irfan reacts after taking a wicket
image.longCaption: Mohammad Irfan reacts after taking a wicket, South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion, March 15, 2013

stories.title: Pakistan face selection conundrum
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion
stories.summary: Pakistan will have to consider playing three seamers after the defeat in Bloemfontein

image.caption: Misbah-ul-Haq runs between the wickets in his knock of 38
image.longCaption: Misbah-ul-Haq runs between the wickets in his knock of 38, South Africa v Pakistan, 1st ODI, Bloemfontein, March 10, 2013

stories.title: South Africa's search for consistency
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion
stories.summary: Due to the focus of Test cricket, South Africa's one-day side has been allowed to drift a bit, but AB de Villiers wants to change that

recentReportStory.title: Irfan, Misbah star as Pakistan draw level
recentReportStory.subTitle: South Africa v Pakistan, 2nd ODI, Centurion
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Mohammad Irfan, Misbah-ul-Haq star as Pakistan draw level
recentReportStory.summary: Pakistan's decision to include an extra pace bowler yielded rich rewards as Mohammed Irfan extracted significant bounce from the Centurion surface to dismantle South Africa's top order
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Firdose Moonda in Centurion
